description.value:
Trigger A creature that isn't holding their breath walks into the hallway or starts their turn in the hallway

Effect The triggering creature must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:18] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected by the smoke.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Sickened]{Sickened 1} by the smoke.

Failure The creature is sickened 1 and takes @Damage[1d6[nonlethal]] damage from choking on the smoke. A creature that falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Unconscious] from the nonlethal damage begins to suffocate in [[/r {1d4+1} #rounds]]{1d4+1 rounds} if not dragged to safety.

Critical Failure As failure, but @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Sickened]{Sickened 2} and @Damage[1d6[persistent,nonlethal]] damage.

The flames and heat deal @Damage[1d6[fire]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:16|basic:true] save) to creatures who end their turns in these burning chambers as long as the fires continue.

Breaking the room's glass window before the fire is extinguished causes the fire within to flare up and deal @Damage[2d6[fire]] damage at the end of that round (rather than the standard 1d6), but once at least three of the burning rooms have their windows ventilated, the smoke in these rooms and in area A16 lessens, and the DC of the Fortitude save to resist its Choke effect is reduced to 11.

details.description: Thick smoke fills this room, making it difficult to see and breathe.
details.disable: While a spell like @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Gust of Wind] can temporarily clear a path through the smoke, the hazard returns at the start of the next round as long as the fires in area A17 continue to burn; @Check[type:survival|dc:18] to know how best to cover your nose and mouth with a wet cloth to help alleviate the choking effects of the smoke.
details.reset: The smoke continues to affect anyone who enters area A16 until the fires in area A17 are extinguished.
